column2: tenngirl26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: with me I have had spotting and cramps since I got it put in and have had serious headachs.

column2: dee, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: I have had the iud for 3 years. I have had alot of problems from really bad pains in my lower belly to really bad bleeding for weeks..

column2: izzy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: IUD was very painful getting it inserted but well worth the pain. Its a great method of BC. Only complaint I have is my period has drastically changed. It is very heavy and long. I've only had the IUD for 8months I hope periods get better.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I got the IUD inserted when my son was 6wks old and I have had it for 2 years. I absolutely love it! I don't have to use a panty liner or anything when I am on my period. The only way I can tell I am is a little spotting but only when I wipe after using the restroom. I got pregnant with my son on the Nuva Ring, and i'm very happy that I chose the IUD. My spouse can't feel it either. I also like having the option of having it taken out early if I decide to have another child. I will definately use it again!!!

column2: ibeka4u2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had my iud for 3 years now, but my concern is I get migraines and they have gotten worse in the past year, to where I have had to miss work and being a single parent it doesnt help either. I dont have a period, just spotting for a day! I love that I dont have to remember to take a pill everyday. I work at a hospital and in the 5 years ive been here I have only seen a few women had embedded IUD's but to me that goes back to the Dr. I have spend a lot of money on co pays to a neurologist to just keep giving me pills to make the migraines better, I was just wanting to know if anyone else has had extremely bad migraines? to the point I have almost gone to the ER just for relief! any suggestions?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: My experience while using the IUD has been great. I had it incerted when my lastchild was 6yrs. old and he is now 13. It will be removed once he turns 16.This will be the full 10yr span of the IUD. There are no side affects to this device, other than a change in bleeding while on your cycle(heavy,light or nothing.) I have been wearing a panty liner since the first year.

column2: sarahf0712, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had the device put in August of 2004 and in October of 2007 I had to be rushed in to emergency surgery. The IUD had poked through my uterus, causing my appendix to move down to cover the hole and this caused appendicitis. The Dr. told my husband that if I didnt go to the ER when i did I wouldnt have woke up the next morning. That is how bad the infection was.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had two different IUDs.  The Mirena is an amazing way of birth control.  I am wanting to get pregnant and I getting pregnant after taking it out is as easy as using the bc.

column2: IUD Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had my IUD put inserted in 2004, it was the best thing I ever did.  Stopped the periods, would sometime show a little but not much.  Plus no more remembering to take a pill each day. The insertion of the IUD is no problem, just a little cramping that was over super quick, removal was the same thing.  Strongly suggest IUD for any women who doesn't want the worry or taking contraception.

column2: PJ, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I GOT THE DEVICE 8/06 AND JUST RECENTLY I WAS TOLD THAT THE DARK DISCOLORATION OF MY FACE AND NECK WAS SIDE AFFECT.  IT LOOKS LIKE A PREGNANCY MASK.  I VISITED A DERMATOLOGIST RECENTLY AND SHE WANTS TO CHARGE $3000.00 TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM WITH SOME TYPE OF CHEMICAL PEEL.  IF SOMEONE OUT THERE CAN TELL ME A DOCTOR WHO CAN TREAT ME WITH ORAL OR TOPICAL MEDICINE, I WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE.  BECAUSE I DON'T HAVE $3000.00 FOR SOMETHING THAT COULD POSSIBLY HEAL ONCE THE DEVICE IS REMOVED.  THANKS
